t: Matthew 11
And*p it came to pass, when Jesus had made an end of commanding his twelve disciples, he departed thence to teach and to preach in their cities.
Now*p when John had heard in the prison the works of Christ, he sent two of his disciples,
And*p said unto him, Art thou he that should come, or do we look for another?
Jesus*p answered and said unto them, Go*r and*r shew*r John*r again*r those*r things*r which*r ye*r do*r hear*r and*r see:*r

The*rp blind*r receive*r their*r sight,*r and*r the*r lame*r walk,*r the*r lepers*r are*r cleansed,*r and*r the*r deaf*r hear,*r the*r dead*r are*r raised*r up,*r and*r the*r poor*r have*r the*r gospel*r preached*r to*r them.*r
And*rp blessed*r is*r he,*r whosoever*r shall*r not*r be*r offended*r in*r me.*r
And*p as they departed, Jesus began to say unto the multitudes concerning John, What*r went*r ye*r out*r into*r the*r wilderness*r to*r see?*r A*r reed*r shaken*r with*r the*r wind?*r
But*rp what*r went*r ye*r out*r for*r to*r see?*r A*r man*r clothed*r in*r soft*r raiment?*r behold,*r they*r that*r wear*r soft*r clothing*r are*r in*r kings'*r houses.*r
But*rp what*r went*r ye*r out*r for*r to*r see?*r A*r prophet?*r yea,*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r and*r more*r than*r a*r prophet.*r
For*rp this*r is*r he,*r of*r whom*r it*r is*r written,*r Behold,*r I*r send*r my*r messenger*r before*r thy*r face,*r which*r shall*r prepare*r thy*r way*r before*r thee.*r

Verily*rp I*r say*r unto*r you,*r Among*r them*r that*r are*r born*r of*r women*r there*r hath*r not*r risen*r a*r greater*r than*r John*r the*r Baptist:*r notwithstanding*r he*r that*r is*r least*r in*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r is*r greater*r than*r he.*r
And*rp from*r the*r days*r of*r John*r the*r Baptist*r until*r now*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r suffereth*r violence,*r and*r the*r violent*r take*r it*r by*r force.*r
For*rp all*r the*r prophets*r and*r the*r law*r prophesied*r until*r John.*r
And*rp if*r ye*r will*r receive*r it,*r this*r is*r Elias,*r which*r was*r for*r to*r come.*r
He*rp that*r hath*r ears*r to*r hear,*r let*r him*r hear.*r
But*rp whereunto*r shall*r I*r liken*r this*r generation?*r It*r is*r like*r unto*r children*r sitting*r in*r the*r markets,*r and*r calling*r unto*r their*r fellows,*r
And*rp saying,*r We*r have*r piped*r unto*r you,*r and*r ye*r have*r not*r danced;*r we*r have*r mourned*r unto*r you,*r and*r ye*r have*r not*r lamented.*r
For*rp John*r came*r neither*r eating*r nor*r drinking,*r and*r they*r say,*r He*r hath*r a*r devil.*r

The*rp Son*r of*r man*r came*r eating*r and*r drinking,*r and*r they*r say,*r Behold*r a*r man*r gluttonous,*r and*r a*r winebibber,*r a*r friend*r of*r publicans*r and*r sinners.*r But*r wisdom*r is*r justified*r of*r her*r children.*r
Then*p began he to upbraid the cities wherein most of his mighty works were done, because they repented not:

Woe*rp unto*r thee,*r Chorazin!*r woe*r unto*r thee,*r Bethsaida!*r for*r if*r the*r mighty*r works,*r which*r were*r done*r in*r you,*r had*r been*r done*r in*r Tyre*r and*r Sidon,*r they*r would*r have*r repented*r long*r ago*r in*r sackcloth*r and*r ashes.*r
But*rp I*r say*r unto*r you,*r It*r shall*r be*r more*r tolerable*r for*r Tyre*r and*r Sidon*r at*r the*r day*r of*r judgment,*r than*r for*r you.*r

And*rp thou,*r Capernaum,*r which*r art*r exalted*r unto*r heaven,*r shalt*r be*r brought*r down*r to*r hell:*r for*r if*r the*r mighty*r works,*r which*r have*r been*r done*r in*r thee,*r had*r been*r done*r in*r Sodom,*r it*r would*r have*r remained*r until*r this*r day.*r
But*rp I*r say*r unto*r you,*r That*r it*r shall*r be*r more*r tolerable*r for*r the*r land*r of*r Sodom*r in*r the*r day*r of*r judgment,*r than*r for*r thee.*r

At*p that time Jesus answered and said, I*r thank*r thee,*r O*r Father,*r Lord*r of*r heaven*r and*r earth,*r because*r thou*r hast*r hid*r these*r things*r from*r the*r wise*r and*r prudent,*r and*r hast*r revealed*r them*r unto*r babes.*r
Even*rp so,*r Father:*r for*r so*r it*r seemed*r good*r in*r thy*r sight.*r

All*rp things*r are*r delivered*r unto*r me*r of*r my*r Father:*r and*r no*r man*r knoweth*r the*r Son,*r but*r the*r Father;*r neither*r knoweth*r any*r man*r the*r Father,*r save*r the*r Son,*r and*r he*r to*r whomsoever*r the*r Son*r will*r reveal*r him.*r
Come*rp unto*r me,*r all*r ye*r that*r labour*r and*r are*r heavy*r laden,*r and*r I*r will*r give*r you*r rest.*r
Take*rp my*r yoke*r upon*r you,*r and*r learn*r of*r me;*r for*r I*r am*r meek*r and*r lowly*r in*r heart:*r and*r ye*r shall*r find*r rest*r unto*r your*r souls.*r
For*rp my*r yoke*r is*r easy,*r and*r my*r burden*r is*r light.*r
